description: 18th century. From Latin erubescens, present participle erubescere (“to grow red”); e (“out”) + rubescere. See rubescent.

adjectives.description: erubescent (comparative more erubescent, superlative most erubescent)

examples: I see you on the edge of a mountain,
You turn and give a smile, you hug me and hold me.
You can see I'm clearly Erubescent.
I hate and I love it at the same time.
